International Restrictions:
*Entry rules in response to coronavirus (COVID-19): The Fiji government has announced changes to international travel due to Covid-19. Whether entry will be permitted to Fiji and what the process is on arrival will depend on individual circumstances but the major consideration is the countries you have visited or transited in the ten days prior to entering Fiji. Fiji has placed all countries into one of three categories: “Travel Partner” countries, which includes the UK; “Non-Travel Partner” countries; and “Red-List” countries. Full information on the latest rules is available from the Ministry of Commerce, Trade, Tourism and Transport and you should familiarise yourself carefully with these. In some cases approval prior to travel must be sought.
A pre-departure coronavirus RT-PCR test is required for all travel to Fiji. The Fiji government has reduced the time when this test can be taken to no more than one day prior to the scheduled day of departure or the first flight in a series of connections booked on the same itinerary. This change is now in effect for those departing from the UK and USA. Only fully vaccinated travellers are able to enter Fiji and the vaccine must be of a type approved by the Fijian authorities. You will also need to ensure you meet testing and vaccination requirements of your airline and any countries transited enroute to Fiji.
Fiji government requires travellers coming for tourist purposes to have medical travel insurance that covers COVID-19. You may transit Nadi Airport from Travel Partner countries if you have a valid ticket, negative COVID-19 test and are fully vaccinated.
All foreign nationals who are currently unable to leave Fiji have been advised to contact Fiji Immigration Office so that they may be properly guided to maintain their legal status. This applies to all categories of permit holders.
These restrictions supersede the regular entry requirements set out below which refer to Fiji’s requirements that existed before the border was closed.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Fiji: Some travel restrictions are in place in Fiji. Ensure you check the latest rules carefully when making travel plans. Mask wearing on public transport is mandatory and people can be fined for non-compliance.
A nationwide curfew is in effect from midnight to 4am every night. More information on the latest restrictions are available on the Fiji government website. *Accommodation: Some hotels and rental accommodation are open with COVID-19 protocols in place. You are likely to be asked for proof of vaccination against COVID-19 when checking-in and may be turned away if you don’t have this.
*Public places and services: Following the lifting of the majority of COVID-19 restrictions in October, many businesses and public places have reopened. Schools have begun a staggered reopening. Everyone is required to follow COVID-19 safety protocols and must use the contact tracing careFiji app to check in and out of businesses and public spaces.
The Fijian Government has introduced regulations that require all workers in both the public and private sector to obtain a COVID-19 vaccination. You may be asked for proof of vaccination when entering businesses including restaurants, bars and hotels. There is a nationwide curfew and everyone is required to remain at home or in their accommodation between midnight and 4am.
*If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
